content.question:
Neptunus muros magnoque emota tridenti

fundamenta quatit totamque a sedibus urbem

eruit. Hic Iuno Scaeas saevissima portas

prima tenet sociumque furens a navibus agmen

5ferro accincta vocat.

Iam summas arces Tritonia, respice, Pallas

insedit nimbo effulgens et Gorgone saeva.

Ipse pater Danais animos viresque secundas

sufficit, ipse deos in Dardana suscitat arma.

10Eripe, nate, fugam finemque impone labori.

Aeneid 2. 610-619

Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question.

1. What Greek’s deceptive words earlier in Book 2 allowed them to breach the walls of Troy?

2. (A) What is the tense and voice of emota (line 1)? (B) Translate it in context.

3. (A) Identify one and only one thing that Neptune does in this passage and (B) write out the specific Latin word or words for the act you identified.

4. (A) Which word does socium (line 4) modify and (B) what are the case and use of that word?

5. (A) What are the case and number of accincta (line 5) and (B) which word does it modify?

6. (A) Identify the two present participles in this passage and (B) translate them in context.

7. In this passage, (A) which one Latin word can be translated as “to the Greeks” and (B) which one Latin word can be translated as “Trojan”?

8. In lines 8-10 (Ipse . . . labori), which two Latin words can together be translated as “escape!”?

9. (A) Identify one and only one literary device found in line 10 (Eripe . . . labori) and (B) write out the Latin word or words that illustrate it.
